title: Fab hotel in a quiet street but within easy reach of Central London

title: Not enough value for the price of the room.
likereview: Great location, nice and attentive staff and good breakfast.
dislikereview: The bed has to be one of the most uncomfortable ones I’ve slept in ages. A very soft and bouncy mattress with which you will wake up with neck and back pain in the morning. I found some stains in the mattress sheet the day we arrived. And in front of our room there was some soiled toilet paper on the carpet next to elevator. The bathroom is almost claustrophobic of how small it is. Nice shower but with very slippery floor. The wifi was almost non existent in the room we were in. If you need it to work, you’re in bad luck. I had to switch to international data plan on my phone almost constantly.

title: Very enjoyable, good air conditioning and you can open the windows if you want to. Great staff also.
likereview: We stayed there before and our visit this time was up to our expectations. I would recommend this hotel, the Park Grand , Kensington. It is in an excellent location for a tourist or a business person.
dislikereview: There are at least 5 steps from the footpath to the entrance door and they does'nt seem to have a wheel-chair lift. (There is a lift inside.) The friendly staff helped me with my luggage and I have no complaints but disabled people should ask the hotel about facilities.

title: Very good
likereview: Location great.Breakfast 10/10, nice to get hot & tasty food. Breakfast staff were exceptionally friendly & helpful.Hotel clean, tidy & comfortable
dislikereview: Tea/coffee/milk not stocked up in room, had to phone for more & it didn't arrive! We needed a drink before going out to the theatre. Chased it up & was told NO milk??  would have been nice to have been kept updated & we could have popped out for some ourselves. They finally brought some in a jug as we were leaving our room to go out! Only 1 bath towel, had to ask for another even though a double room.Coffee/water flasks in reception cold (on 2 occasions) & although we nicely mentioned it to a member of staff standing next to it nothing was done, & it was not replenished, but ignored!

title: Great room facilities with minor issues
likereview: I got the Deluxe Double.Room facilities -  There was a microwave, fridge, iron + ironing board, full tea/coffee amenities, light switches with individual controls, large 'modern' TV, hairdryer, safety box/locker, many large mirrors and great air conditioning/heatingIT facilities - There was a whole panel of ports (i.e. HDMI, USB) to connect to the TV and many sockets (at least 4?)Bathroom - I loved the shower! There were 2 shower options, a regular shower head and another that is attached to the ceiling right above you. Water pressure + heating was excellent. Bathroom amenities provided - soap, shampoo, conditioner, extra toilet rolls, lotion.Room service - food was reasonably priced and fairly cheap for a hotel and halal options available. Location - literally just about a minute walk to tube station (Earl's Court) with many grocery stores/ restaurants nearby.
dislikereview: Customer care - I waited at the reception to check in for quite a while. They were busy to begin with which I understood. But when they served another customer before me who just arrived, I was a little annoyed. Also, the receptionist dealing with my check in was sneezing/coughing multiple times into their bare hands which I was uncomfortable with as they were handling my debit card and room key card. At least they apologised but I would have preferred if they washed their hands rather than just squirt a tiny bit of sanitiser.The bed - the double bed was huge, but it was two single beds put together so I couldn't sleep in the middle. Plus, both mattresses had different "firmness" with one more firm and the other that sunk in. Old(ish) furniture/ carpet - Furniture looks a bit run down and the chair in the room at the desk sunk in and was uncomfortable (but it's not terrible). Carpet was also not very clean with some stains (but I turned a blind eye to this)Lift - it was so much slower than most lifts, even at cheaper hotels (I could walk up the stairs to the 4th floor faster than the lift) BUT having a lift is better than no lift so it's not the worst. There was only one lift though.

title: Comfort, good breakfast but do not forget to ask for your room to be cleaned!
likereview: Room comfortable and quiet.Breakfast very good - lots of choice but only scrambled eggs - prefer fried, poached etc.Staff very helpful.
dislikereview: The most odd thing was that our room was not cleaned during our stay, until we specifically requested it. I have stayed in many, many hotels in Europe, UK, America, Canada, and this is the only hotel I have come across where the room is cleaned only if you ask for it to be done. We were told we had to press a "Clean room" button in our room. This is OK if rather odd, but no one told us we had to this. It was not mentioned in the instructions in the room either.

dislikereview: They forgot to put a bar fridge in the room at first but did put one in when we queried how to keep our supplies cold.  Breakfast was good but would have liked plain yoghurt rather than all fruit based.

title: London city break
likereview: The hotel itself is lovely. It's a great location. Very close to Earl's Court tube and loads of shops and restaurants close by
dislikereview: The reception staff were not a bit welcoming or even helpful. I found them abrupt and dismissive

title: Overall good for Kensington.
likereview: Location and room were good. Good air conditioning,  no traffic noise, pleasant staff.
dislikereview: The breakfast could have been better. Only 2 fruits  and poor choice of cereal, no muesli or granola. The bread was just about the cheapest one could buy. However my partner said that the cooked option (which I never eat) was good!

title: Superb
likereview: Friendly staff and excellent location.

title: Not really a good choice
likereview: location is very good, 5 minutes walk to the metro, staff was friendly and welcoming. hotel is clean in general.
dislikereview: Room too small, AC grill is directed to the bed which is not appropriate, there is no option any way due to room size.Breakfast is with limited options but quality of food is good. They wrote on the restaurant that everything is Halal, we even verified this verbally with the reception staff that breakfast food all Halal; we found out majority of the breakfast items are pork and nothing is written on it.

title: Great experience, worth the money.
likereview: Everything is class. Staffs were friendly, the room was clean, great location which is just 5 mins walk to underground station.

title: Perfectly adequate for what we needed.
likereview: Great value for money for the location. Staff were very quick to respond to any requests e.g. we asked for an extra towel and they brought it immediately. Free bottles of water provided every day which was definitely needed in the heatwave. Shower water pressure was great. Air conditioning worked well, again very necessary for the heatwave during our visit!
dislikereview: The hot water was turned off one night without any warning which was frustrating. Elevator was very slow and could do with upgrading. When we arrived there were about 10 people behind the desk but none of them called us forward to check into our room. There were no facecloths in the room, and face washing is a must when using the London Underground!

title: excellent would go back
likereview: location bed shower
dislikereview: the bath towels were smallest I’ve ever had in a nice hotel, would not wrap around your body. I asked for more which they happily provided but they were same size!!! I am 5 foot 2 inches and 8 stone so wasn’t asking for much!!

title: very good
likereview: friendly staff great location to station
dislikereview: small rooms - quite dark

title: good stay infact the best hotel in that area in that budget

title: Attractive modern hotel with great location
likereview: Great location for travelling to tourist attractions in London. Staff very welcoming and friendly. Room featured excellent quality bathroom with powerful shower. Air conditioning prevented room overheating during the hot weather. Good selection of hot and cold food provided for breakfast. Attractive modern hotel with good decor.
dislikereview: Had to wait an hour for room to be ready on arrival.  Room itself although very clean was a bit on the small side.

title: excellent stay thank you
likereview: lovely clean room, nice bar area.

title: Lovely  would stay again
likereview: Great location for museums, Kensington Road, Harrods and a nice walk to Hyde Park
dislikereview: If I was being Fussy, the pillows were a little low for my personal preference but if I contacted reception, they would have brought more.

title: Very good
likereview: Good location staff friendly and helpful
dislikereview: On arrival was asked if we didn't mind a room on ground level which I presumed was ground floor it was in the basement so no windows which made it very dark this was not explained at reception.i could have complained but just couldn't be bothered to go back up .

title: Very nice hotel; friendly staff. Good location
likereview: very friendly & helpful staff. There were 4 members of staff in reception when we got there so they were very quick to get us checked in & one of them showed us to our room. We turned up about 1.15 & weren’t meant to be able to check in until 2 but the room was all ready. It was a really hot day & they’d put the air con on to cool the room down which was really nice. We booked a deluxe room which was very nice but quite small.There were bottles of water & Coke in the room which were free. There was also a small bottle of wine but we didn’t know if it was free so we left it there. Breakfast was a full english that you help yourself to. The chef was happy to cook the eggs the way you wanted them.Check out time was midday which was great as it meant we didn’t have to rush offThe hotel is only 2 minutes walk from Earls Court tube station so a really good location.
dislikereview: The only drawback was that the fridge in the room didn’t work so we couldn’t keep anything cold. We did report it when we arrived but it didn’t get fixed.

title: Superb
likereview: Great location close to earls court tube.Very friendly staff.Very clean.12 noon checkout is helpful
dislikereview: Bar closes very early which is frustrating. More tea bags should be left in room, but the team will bring you some up.Breakfast is buffet style and at times was getting cooler

title: Great location, lovely room, fantastic staff.
likereview: Location was great as we were visiting the Royal Albert Hall for an event and the room was a good size. Bed was also very comfortable and the staff were very friendly.
dislikereview: I was in a lower floor room and so there was no natural light, as I was going to an event i wasn't too sure how my make up looked as the lighting wasn't amazing in the room.

title: nice place , great location , lots to do in the area
likereview: staff and ammenities great and very close to earl’s court underground
dislikereview: it is very good

title: The staff were friendly, breakfast was nice.  Location for nearest tube station for london is great.
likereview: The room was a bit small but adequate for our 2 night stay.  The location was excellent, just a short walk to Earls Court subway.  The breakfast was nice and well cooked.
dislikereview: I didn't like the fact that in this day and age you actually had to pay to get wi-fi connection which spoilt my stay.

title: Very good
likereview: Very helpful staff, they decorated the room as it was my mums Birthday, she was really pleased!  lovely room and great location

title: Great location and nice staff!
likereview: Great location to access tourist London and Heathrow Airport.  Staff was very nice and offered water when we arrived.  The room was well stocked with water and the shower was fabulous!  Very hot with excellent water pressure.
dislikereview: Even though the air conditioning was set to 19C if felt warmer than that in the room because air did not circulate.  We raised the level of the fan, but that did not help.

title: Very good
likereview: Breakfast was good. The breakfast room was lovely. Great location for travelling to Wimbeldon and the city.
dislikereview: The view from our room was not great, it was just an internal yard.

title: Very good
likereview: Staff were lovely and v accomodating
dislikereview: Noisy, especially in the morning. To do with heating/ventilation

title: Great short break in London
likereview: good location, bedroom was a good size for London and very clean.
dislikereview: can’t really complain about anything, we got a very good rate when booking so the hotel was well worth it. if I had Booked at a later date with the prices that were quoted i oiled be a bit more critical. all in all though a good hotel for a couple of days in London

title: Friendly staff, great location, comfortable stay
likereview: The location was great- super easy access to Earl’s Court tube station and plenty of food options, but quiet and safe. The staff were very friendly and helpful. They were always smiling and welcoming us back or sending us off in the morning telling us to have a great day. We were early arriving, and they had our rooms ready with very little wait (and tagged our luggage to hold so we could go on out and explore if we wanted to). They also accommodated our request to have three rooms together.Prior to arriving, I had reached out to the hotel with some questions and they were very helpful. The rooms were nice (on the small side, but that seems to be the norm in London) and the showers had the best pressure I’ve ever seen :) Air conditioning was cool on hot days- a luxury we won’t take for granted after other places we visited on this trip. I would stay here again and definitely recommend it!
dislikereview: Breakfast was not great - no a la carte options and the buffet wasn’t very well stocked the day we gave it a try. Everyone was doing their best, and the host was very pleasant. When we were leaving he told me they had just brought breakfast back recently since before COVID, so they might still be working out the kinks (and everywhere we went in England, places seemed to be short staffed.) Also, if you’re a coffee drinker, the coffee in the rooms is instant. It did the trick, but there are a few good options on Earl’s Court if you need the real stuff :)

title: Comfortable  clean hotel. Quiet but convenient location
likereview: Good breakfast. Very comfy bed. Good shower
dislikereview: More choice at breakfast eg more fruit

dislikereview: The price of our stay and the room could have been a bit bigger.

title: Great for a visiting London, would stop here again
likereview: The room was a little small but clean and pleasant.  Breakfast was good and the staff very attentive.  The location was excellent, 2 mins from the tube giving easy access to central London and only 15 minutes walk to Kensington High Street.

This was accentuated by harsh, white electric lighting in the room itself.  The room was big but did not look like the room we had booked in the booking.com advert.  However, reception staff were kind and accommodating when we complained and moved us to a different room without fuss.

title: Good
likereview: location mainly

title: Overall nice stay.
likereview: Stayed here Monday 30th May-Wednesday 1st June 2022. The staff upon check in were very nice, lead us to our room and carried my bag for me. The room was clean and spacious enough. There was complimentary water too. There was the usual kettle etc. in the room but also a mini fridge and microwave which was great. Bed was spacious and comfortable. Room was in the floor below. No noise. Staff were kind and polite. Didn't spend a great amount of time in the hotel as was out exploring London but the time I did it was good. Wifi was free. Shower had the waterfall shower and a detachable head. Overall lovely stay, good value for money in London and would stay again.
dislikereview: Overall stay was really good. Only suggestions would be that there is better lighting for getting ready when putting my make up on etc. and if they install a towel rail or something in the bathroom to hang towels.

title: Great location - Check which floor your room is when booking
likereview: The hotel was in a great location, and the staff were very polite and helpful. Everything was clean, and the breakfast was delicious.
dislikereview: I booked a deluxe double room for my wife's birthday as we were attending a gig in June. I was disappointed that we were at basement level with no windows, and no natural light. For the cost of the room for two nights, I would have expected to be able to see outside... Also, my wife suffers with allergies and didn't sleep very well as a result of not being able to let some fresh air into the room.

title: Very good
likereview: the staff was very friendly and helpful. I even recived a free upgrade which was great - thank you. I recommend the hotel and would book again. So far the best Park Grand in London with the friendliest staff.
dislikereview: The shower was not super clean. You can see well that there is mould. This should be removed as soon as possible, as there is already a lot of it. Otherwise, the room and bathroom were clean.

dislikereview: The free internet was not great, I had a hard time getting on and staying on.

title: Very good
dislikereview: Inside the lift there was graffiti

title: Overnight stay, great if you're visiting a concert at the Royal Albert Hall
likereview: Great location, really comfortable room and bed
dislikereview: Unfortunately there was a fault with the fire alarm system as it went off throughout the hotel at 1:50am, besides that it was a great night's sleep

title: Good
likereview: Very close to earls court tube, clean room, comfortable, room felt newly renovated, not a bad size for london, location and price point
dislikereview: Lobby felt grubby, room didnt have window / natural light but didnt bother me as was only there for 8 hrs sleep!

title: Superb

title: Superb
likereview: Location and staff very helpful

title: really good, located hotel
likereview: the room was adequate, the staff helpful and extremely polite
dislikereview: nothing

title: Good
likereview: Nice staff, comfy beds. Our request to be moved to a room with sunlight was immediately accommodated. The location is exceptional! Right by the tube station with access to the Piccadilly and district line. Walking distance to various attractions.
dislikereview: The first night we were in a basement room, no sunlight whatsoever.  For 180 £ a night I did expect more, but then again it’s London and a rather expensive area. The breakfast was not good at all, very bland and few choices. I recommend going to one of the nearby cafes.

title: Superb
likereview: The hotel is a 5 minute walk subway
dislikereview: We have nothing negative to say about the hotel

title: The Park Grand hotel Kensington offers comfortable accommodation , within 300m of the Earls Court underground !
likereview: very accommodating reception staff. Nothing was too much of a problem.
dislikereview: Breakfasts only offer one diced fruit. a fruit salad and plain yoghurt not on offer

title: Good location, okay facilities
likereview: Great location, friendly staff. Very convenient for Earls Court station and easy walking distance to Kensington High Street. All the staff were very keen to help and very friendly. Breakfast was nice but a little limited.
dislikereview: Our room was on floor -2, which was unexpected and had very limited natural light. There was also no lift down to this floor so meant taking cases down and up 2 flights of stairs. Also room felt a little tiered.

title: Very good
likereview: Good location for our arrangements. Friendly staff and nice sized room. Had a very nice meal at Turmeric Kitchen in hotel and good breakfasts. Would recommend.
dislikereview: Would rather have had a non disability bathroom but we arrived early and assume this one was available.

title: Very good
likereview: great location, wonderful staff, good value for money

title: our five night stay was quiet and. comfortable
likereview: Proximity to the Underground and lots of restaurants ta and shops.

title: Conveniently located and close to restaurants
likereview: Close to the station, friendly and helpful staff who arranged taxis for us.  Nice bathrobe and slippers to use.
dislikereview: Had a weird skylight in our room that looked like it was taped up with masking tape.

title: Very good
likereview: Very comfortable, great location
dislikereview: Nothinh

title: great location, good price for London
likereview: great location, really nice staff
dislikereview: rain shower head wasn’t cleaned once and was dirty on our arrival, couldn’t use it al all during the trip and it made the shower feel dirty

title: Superb
likereview: Helpful, responsive staff

title: Very friendly staff, clean room, good location
likereview: Very friendly staff on arrival / checkout. The room was generally clean (a little bit dated), but not unclean. Bathroom facilities were excellent, with toiletries and bathrobe available in the room.
dislikereview: It’s not what we didn’t like, as this would sound picky, but the lights by the bed wouldn’t turn off using the dimmer switches, so we just resorted to removing the key card. Other than that, it was faultless.

title: Absolutely lovely
likereview: Location perfect, room very comfortable and breakfast superb
dislikereview: Too much single use plastic

title: overall nice , friendly ,clean hotel in a decent location with food places and shops
likereview: the location is excellent right next to Earl’s Court tube!! beautiful reception friendly staff.
dislikereview: not a lot really they took a holding deposit of £150.66 I expected to pay the balance due but then had to pay the whole amount again and they refund the holding deposit, only because I asked when I got a receipt to say it had been done.  also one of the twin beds were broken which we didn’t realise until day 2, propped up with MDF I had to use the bathrobes to prop up the mattress and stop my friend rolling out, everything was unpacked so we didn’t want to have to move rooms.

title: Very good
likereview: Location was excellent. Hotel was very clean and comfortable .
dislikereview: WiFi didn't work, staff at times could ignore you. Breakfast selection wasn't great. I booked a twin room and while it had 2 separate beds, they were right beside each other, no gap between the beds so we had to pull them apart. No normal breakfast tea in the room

title: Good
likereview: The staff were lovely, very hospitable. The bathroom facilities were very nice and the room was clean.
dislikereview: The bed was quite uncomfortable. Very hard and lumpy, the pillows were thin and hard too. Additionally, there was emergency lighting which was on all night in the room which kept me up. (appreciate this may be a health and safety requirement though.)

title: Very good
likereview: Restaurant food was good

title: Superb
likereview: Booked way in advance for a great price.
dislikereview: We requested a bottle of champagne in the room on arrival. It wasn't delivered.

title: Superb
likereview: Location, ambience, customer service
dislikereview: Beds a little hard for me (personal preference)Carpet's need a good vacuum

title: Very good
likereview: Friendly, helpful staff.Clean, quiet room. We liked the underfloor heating in the bathroomConvenient for the tube
dislikereview: Breakfast was good value but not interesting

title: Superb
likereview: The hotel is very close to the tube station, the staff were really helpful from start to finish!

title: Fourth visit and look forward to the next one!
likereview: Ample amenities in deluxe rooms - kettle, microwave, strong WiFi, international plugs, good water pressure, nice views on a peaceful street, bathrobes! This plus the location -- direct on the Picadilly Line from both Heathrow and St. Pancras, easy walk to Kensington High Street -- make for a perfect base in London. Staff extremely kind and helpful.
dislikereview: Mattresses could use an upgrade. Could be an issue for anyone who needs firm support. OK for a day or two.

title: Overall it was fine.
likereview: great location, nice hotel
dislikereview: Used underwear was hanging on the bathroom hook when we checked in. Disgusting. Also the room was very tiny, it was hard to move around and there was no place for luggage. European hotels are usually small, and this one was definitely small.

title: as somewhere to sleep ok, doubt I would return
likereview: small but comfortable room. hotel 4 minutes walk from earls court tube.
dislikereview: very limited choice of breakfast. small room on 5th floor with very slow lift. rooms in need of upgrade. no information on breakfast or amenities given on check in

title: I would definitely stay at this hotel again
likereview: Front Desk Staff were helpful, professional, and friendly
dislikereview: The bed was very uncomfortable, mattress needs to be replaced

title: A nice hotel in a great location close to Earls Court Tube Station.
likereview: Brilliant location just a few minutes walk from Earls Court Tube Station, situated down a quiet side street in Kensington. The staff were very friendly and helpful. our room was smaller than expected but very comfortable and quiet.
dislikereview: Inside the hotel was a bit shabby in places and the carpet on the way to our room was very dirty. Our room was a lot smaller than suggested on the website as described as a superior double!

title: If you get a decent room, it's OK. Otherwise tough luck.
likereview: Excellent location near Earl's Court station. The second room we got was decent. The first one, see below.
dislikereview: We arrived quite late in the evening and apparently the hotel was fully booked, so we got the absolute worst room in the building. I won't post pictures of the "view" and where it's located, but that room should not be available for paying guests. I'm not picky, in fact the staff also seems to be well aware of how bad it is, because the next day we were given a decent room without even asking. On one hand it's nice of them to rectify the situation, but on the other hand taking money for a room like that is quite shady.

title: We will come back !
likereview: - friendly staff, they were really helpful !- hotel located near Earl’s Court Station and several bus stops- beautiful neighborhood- clean rooms with facilities- early check in! I guess we’ve been lucky because our room was available in the morning- quick check out
dislikereview: Completely independent from the hotel:- noisy customers- noisy neighborhood at night (not every night though)

title: Very pleasant, very convenient, and would stay there again
likereview: The location is fantastic, it is very close to the tube. The staff is friendly and helpful and sorted a problem in the bathroom right away. Breakfast was ample and good.
dislikereview: Our room was a bit difficult to get to, one has to go up and down some steps and corridors. Definitely an exercise for navigating, but not a big deal.

title: A good value hotel in a good location with quiet rooms
likereview: The hotel was in good location for museums and tube stations.  Some good restaurants within a 15 min walk.  The bedroom was quiet which we very much appreciated and the staff in general were friendly.
dislikereview: The maintenance in the bedroom could perhaps have been a little higher.  Greater attention to details in the bathroom which although was clean, was a little tired in places.  The hotel calls the restaurant the Turmeric Kitchen - an Indian restaurant.  There was no sign of a menu either at the restaurant or in the room.  We decided not to eat there as recent reviews also suggested things had gone down hill a bit.  It also seemed very quiet when we passed it in the evenings.  Breakfast was Ok but I think a lot of the food had been under warm lamps for some while so things like the bacon and scrambled egg were pretty dry.  Service often not very attentive although if a waiter was asked for anything it was brought quickly to the table.

title: Very good
likereview: The hotel is very well located. The metro line is a 3 minute walk away and it is deserted from all the tourist stops.The staff was very friendly. They even thought of giving chocolates to my mother for her birthday

title: Well run and comfortable hotel with excellent staff.
likereview: Excellent location for tube. Room and hotel was quiet at night. All the staff were extremely efficient, friendly, polite and helpful.
dislikereview: Our bath floor felt very slippery when wet after a shower - perhaps some sort of small rail to help get out would be helpful. The hot food at breakfast could be a bit hotter.

title: We would be content to stay again at this hotel.
likereview: Excellent breakfast. Very convenient location for public transport, visitor facilities, shops, restaurants.. Quiet street.Quiet room.Friendly and helpful staff.
dislikereview: Lack of subtitles on TV - for the deaf or hard of hearing, this really matters. Excessively complicated lighting arrangement and shower/bath taps. Very poor lighting at armchair position. Brick wall view from window, room 119.

title: Superb
likereview: Fantastic location. Two minutes walk from Earls Court Underground. It was great!

title: We had a nice time there, one or two small problems but all sorted.
likereview: The breakfast was very good, there was a large choice of food .

title: Great for the one night we needed. Staff were fantastic.
likereview: Staff were very friendly and accommodating and offered complementary items. Breakfast was also very good and chefs we're accommodating for dietary requirements. All very professional.
dislikereview: Bed needed new mattress, was significantly sunken in middle. No view our of window, was just a walled area. However we understand that some rooms will be this way.

title: great value for money. location fantastic. 5 min walk from Earls Court station. would stay there again.
likereview: fab location, really helpful staff.
dislikereview: n/a

title: Superb
likereview: The staff are very accomodating. We wanted to change our room because we were given a room that is facing a wall from another building. I requested for a room change and it was approved with no buts or ifs. Amazing staff.

When we didn’t even have any windows open. Breakfast was very average with little variety.

dislikereview: I opted for the smaller room size and if visiting in the future I think I would opt for the bigger room, as space was a bit limited with 2 of us getting ready in the morning. Other than that couldn't fault the rooms.

title: Good
dislikereview: The breakfast is really poor.

title: Great, would book again, staff fantastic.
likereview: Before we arrived I requested something special to be done in the room as it was our 21st Wedding Anniversary and they did not disappoint, the room was stunning, swan towels on bed with rose petals, chocolates and wine, fantastic. Front of house were excellent and couldn't do enough for you. Breakfast was really good and much variety to choose from. For 2 people good size room and got what I requested. 1st Class.
dislikereview: Petty things, back of bathroom door needed cleaning, covered in smear marks, bedding had hole in sheets (had no problem changing these) remote for telly would not work correctly. Fridge in room but could not access as locked. Lot of noise in street early mornings, dustmen etc which cannot be helped but if windows properly double glazed would reduce noise dramatically.

title: Good location, standard city break hotel. Fine but unexceptional.
likereview: standard city hotel. has everything you need. location within a short stroll of Earls Court tube but on a quiet road.

title: Very good

title: Very nice hotel. Will be back

dislikereview: Nothing

title: Superb

Beside that, during my stay at the hotel I celebrated my birthday and the staff prepared me a nice surprise on behalf of this occasion. This was really a very excited and moving gesture. I appreciate it very much.

dislikereview: Rooms are a little small and more thought could be given to the positioning of the wardrobe right next to the bed which makes for a tight space with difficult access to the cupboard and hanging area. Opposite the end of the bed next to the desk would be a better place for the wardrobe with the TV on an angled bracket next to the bed or over the desk - think about it please!

title: Great Location for London Touring
likereview: Great location on District and Piccadilly lines, so easy to tourist core and LHR.  Good neighborhood with restaurants and pubs.

title: Definitely recommend
likereview: Great location very close to earls court tube station and shops, good size room (has a nice big window which allows a good amount of light in),  microwave in the room which was useful and a few drinks were also given complementary.  Staff were very kind and helpful. I asked to leave a card for my friend before arrival which was perfect.

title: Clean, comfortable beds, well equipped rooms, friendly staff, convenient location (5 mins walk from
likereview: The room was clean, the beds and pillows very comfortable and all accessories such as hairdryer and kettle were in good condition and working. There were bottles of water, biscuits, tea and coffee in the room. The breakfast was also good. The hotel is maximum 5 minutes walk from Earl's Court tube station. Overall, we enjoyed our stay!

title: A comfortable and rewarding stay!
likereview: Park Grand Kensington has a lovely staff - intelligent, interactive and caring. Nelly in reception is quite outstanding. Breakfasts were very good, including fresh fruit and a comprehensive range of cooked items. Coffee and tea was provided at reception during the day as were daily papers. Evening meals provided a reasonable menu from which to choose with particular emphasis on Indian dishes. We met some really interesting people at Park Grand Kensington, especially from countries other than UK.
dislikereview: Perhaps the evening menu in the dining room could be extended a little yet without losing quality - eg non-Indian vegetarian dishes.

title: Excellent Location!
likereview: the location!! really close to Earl’s Court Station, there’s loads of restaurants/pub nearby. very quiet area!
dislikereview: maybe the room allocated (room 007) it’s not that we expected though 😒

title: Noisy neighbours
likereview: Pretty clean and tidy plus located near Earls Court tube
dislikereview: The walls didn’t cut out the sounds from the next room where a couple were arguing til gone 3am

title: A great hotel in a nice area with friendly and professional staff and a good breakfast!
likereview: Location perfect for us as we had tickets for a show in Shepherds Bush and it was very simple to get there by tube, especially as the hotel is a short, easy walk from  Earls Court station.  Room and bathroom lovely and clean. Surprisingly didn't hear any road noise when in our room as the hotel was on a quiet road. Breakfast very good, ate one evening meal in hotel which was delicious. The hotel bar is within the restaurant so sadly no comfy chairs to sit in for a quiet drink but other than that very happy with our stay. Staff were all lovely. Would stay again.

title: great value for money with very friendly service
likereview: great location for the albert hall visit i had booked. Staff were great and very freindly. Food in the restaurant was excellent and very well priced.
dislikereview: nothing

title: Very good
likereview: Staff, location and spacious well equipped room.Great having a small fridge and microwave to use.
dislikereview: Beds and pillows bit hard

title: Very good
likereview: the room was brilliant
dislikereview: communication with front desk was not as good

title: Good
likereview: Location was great, just a short minute walk to Earl’s Court station. Room was clean but best of all is the heated bathroom floor!
dislikereview: The have rooms in the basement with no window / view and sadly we got that on our first night. We asked to change room the next day because it feels quite claustrophobic sleeping without a window and waking ip without sunlight. I think they’re used to this issue, as we got a better room with no question asked. Just hoping that they didn’t send us to the basement at all when other better rooms are available.

title: Not perfect but unbelievable value for money in London. Would highly recommend!
likereview: Excellent staff and great facilities. The room was clean and had complimentary bottled water, coffee and biscuits each day. Great location, just 10 mins walk from Gloucester Road tube station and 15 mins from Kensington High street. Having a microwave in the room was great too.
dislikereview: The decor is a little tired and the shower screen on the bathroom leaked. Had an issue with the plug in the bath too. Very soft mattress not to our taste but that is our personal preference. Some buttons on the TV remote we’re broken.

title: Superb

title: For the center of London this was a good find.  I was comfortable and happy and would recommend.
likereview: The location of this hotel was within walking distance to Earls Court tube station, close to groceries and many restaurants.  The bed was wonderful and there were several pillows available.  It was surprisingly quiet for the central location.  There was a fridge and microwave and tea/coffee facilities in the room.  The staff were able to give recommendations for local restaurants and directions to the grocery etc. in the vicinity.  They were also able to store the luggage after checkout.
dislikereview: Some hard boiled eggs may have been nice or some variety of egg rather than scrambled only.  There was limited space in the bathroom to place toiletries.

title: We had an enjoyable two night stay. Excellent location in London.
likereview: Everything was very good.  No complaints.
dislikereview: Nothing

title: Great 4star stay
likereview: Everything, from the welcome through to the goodbye. The staff at all areas were professional, courteous and friendly.  The room and it's facilities were all you needed, including a microwave if you didn't fancy eating out or going downstairs to the restaurant . 5 mins away were supermarkets so you could collect any food to have back in the room. Or get a delivery!Our stay was built around my husband attending the Cromwell hospital 5 minutes away. He actually had to stay in for 6 days. But I would have breakfast at the hotel then go up and visit him. The breakfast was all you needed from continental through to full English! Perfect!!On the lower ground floor was a fully equipped fitness room which was just what I needed as I train regularly back at home. I ate in the Turmeric restaurant in the evening. Wonderful cooked Indian food and great value for money, in a 4 star hotel!!Great hotel, staff and location.  ****
dislikereview: The thing was the WiFi which was hit n miss. One of the staff came to the room to get my tablet to work but unfortunately it didn't last. I am not brilliant at tech, I must say it may have been me!! But that's the only thing, which in the grand scheme of things isn't much to complain  about.

title: Perfect Location. Enjoyable Stay. Will be back.
likereview: Location was excellent. 4 minute walk to Earls Court Tube Station. Close to pubs, supermarket and other amenities. Staff were helpful and let us check in early around 1:15 as they had availability. Room was very spacious and I looked out onto the road which was very quiet. If I am staying in London I would stay here again.

title: Great hotel for first time in London.
likereview: Park Grand London Kensington is in a great location 2 minutes walk to the underground station Earls Court and within walking to shops/cafes/restaurants.  I would stay there again, the room was a decent size and the bathroom too.  The room was kept clean on a daily basis by staff.  Thank you for an enjoyable first stay in London!

title: The facilities I would expect of a four star hotel at a two star hotel price.
likereview: Very large comfortable bed, excellent walk-in shower, good desk and choice of chair or stool for working, decent storage space with closing doors on the wardrobe, very large TV and very quiet room. The room was very clean, and carpets were fresh-looking with no signs of wear and tear. The price I paid (£75) for one night in a four star hotel close to Earl's Court tube and within walking distance of the museums at South Kensington was extremely low. Good tea/coffee making facilities but I did wonder if the proximity of the kettle to the smoke alarm meant that it could cause occasional false-alarms (I did not experience any of these).
dislikereview: The TV faces the bed and cannot be watched from a chair, only by sitting or lying on the bed. The view from the bedroom windows is not very inspiring, overlooking the flat roof of the back of the reception area, (however this contributes greatly to making the room very quiet).

title: Really enjoyable
likereview: Cleanliness and location

title: Very affordable and great, minus WiFi
likereview: If you're not concerned about having free wifi, then this ought to be the perfect hotel in every other aspect as I found my stay extremely pleasant. Not only was the location perfect, given the straight train from Heathrow Airport to Earl's Court via the Piccadilly line and the hotel itself being a very short walk from the tube station, the room was also very spacious, had everything you could need, and very affordable too. Also, breakfast was pretty great I did not find myself bored of it in the six days spent there. As for the WiFi, not only was it a free one that anyone could connect into, it wouldn't allow me to use many apps (including social media) nor visit many websites beyond Google/basic functions. I have no idea why this is the case, but upon relooking at reviews with specific mentions of WiFi problems I realized I was not the only one facing such an issue. Still give this a 4/5 overall as I managed without the wifi by paying for my own data service, however, if you depend on the free wifi you might want to consider staying elsewhere. Otherwise, this hotel is absolutely amazing for its price.
dislikereview: Weak WiFi connection

dislikereview: room was too small and there was no coffee shop only one restaurant.

likereview: Staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was delicious. The room was comfortable and well equipped and the bed was very comfy
dislikereview: There were several matresses and various cleaning equipment dumped in the corner of our floor corridor, which was quite untidy and unsightly

title: Good
likereview: Location, perfect for getting around central London. Gym facilities were useful but limited if it had been busier. Staff friendly and very helpful. Upgraded us to much bigger room. Price, less than 400 for 4 nights in such a great location.
dislikereview: Hotel really needs a refurb, fixtures and fittings and decor quite worn out, but we did pay less than 400 I guess. Although we were really pleased to get an upgrade to a much larger room it was on lower ground floor so no windows.

title: Enjoyed the stay so much that we didn’t want to leave for sightseeing

title: Would stay again, excellent value for money
likereview: The bed was ever so comfy we had a really good nights sleep. All of the staff were helpful, polite and happy!! The location was excellent for the tube. The cooked breakfast was nice and tasty.
dislikereview: Car parking was an issue (we were booked to come down by train but then the train was cancelled and we had to sort parking) The duvet was not big enough for the bed, it didn't quite cover the mattress. The breakfast was limited - only 2 choices of bread. Only toffee yoghurt. No bananas. The small selection of ham and cheese was dry and turned up at the corners. the apple juice was off

title: can’t wait to come back!

title: Nice hotel at good price

title: A lovely boutique hotel in central London.
likereview: Great location, reasonably priced, and able to accommodate us at short notice (we only reserved on the day due to finding out we couldn’t get home due to the trains having been cancelled due to the storm).  Extremely comfortable bed and great shower.  Beautiful breakfast too.  And there were robes in our room - a lovely luxury touch.
dislikereview: A couple of minor things: no English tea bags in the room (just herbal tea) and no shower gel in the bathroom (just lots of shampoo).  I’m sure the hotel could have rectified this if I had asked.  However, I used my own shower gel and made do with instant coffee!

likereview: This time I booked the club double room which was much better for my needs. More spacious and had slippers etc. This is what I'd expect from a 4 star hotel. Some of the staff are lovely and professional (light brown haired girl working morning of 18th Jan and guy working on 19th Jan in the morning). The wifi worked much better in club double too, no idea why. However, it keeps dropping out on my phone.
dislikereview: Some of the walls and carpets are stained which are off putting. Walls need to be wiped down and carpets perhaps replaced with wooden flooring. It still confuses me why hotels lay carpets. Its so unhygienic, especially in a pandemic. None of the staff were masks and we are still in a pandemic. Why?? Room service is not easy to reach. Took me several phone calls and I eventually called the restaurant number instead of the room service number.

The location of the hotel was very good as well; only a very short walk from the closest underground station, and in an area that felt very safe.

title: On The Whole Was Okay.

However it's so easy to hop on the tube to The West End or Soho. The restaurant at the hotel was very reasonable but it lacked atmosphere so we didn't use it. Beds were comfy. The housekeeping was great, polite and efficient cleaners.
dislikereview: The bathroom was far too cramped but we asked for a bath and wish we hadn't! No Smart TV. Tea/coffee facilites poor, kettle area too small, quite dangerous when boiling kettle. Lumpy pillows. Children were running up and down corridors at 4 am one morning!

title: Definitely be staying again.

Also went above and beyond for a birthday surprise when we arrived in the room which was such a lovely touch to the stay.
dislikereview: Only 2 minor improvements to be added;- 1.) More pillows to the rooms. 1 pillow on each side of the bed isn’t a lot. Probably be asked about at reception. - 2.) The tea and coffee selection in the room just to add some hot chocolate sachets too, especially coming up to the winter months just a nice little touch

title: This hotel offers good value, is very clean, with good food, in a very accessible part of London.
likereview: This hotel offers good value accommodation and food for a very accessible part of London, 5 minutes walk from Earls Court tube station and some 20 minutes walk (or short bus ride) from the V & A Museum, Natural History Museum and Science Museum. (do check opening days!). The hotel and bedroom was very clean and orderly and the staff friendly and efficient. The buffet breakfast was fine, the hot food option was of a high standard with eggs cooked quickly to order while you wait. Continental choices were good but perhaps a little limited. I would not hesitate to revisit.
dislikereview: Cheap toilet paper! Limited continental breakfast choice but of good quality

title: Comfortable, clean and well located
likereview: The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was large, comfortable, and well equipped with a desk, kettle, fridge and safe, and I felt very well looked after. It was also very close to the subway and many shops and restaurants so I had everything I needed within easy walking distance. It was also the only place I stayed this trip that had consistent, sufficient hot water in the shower.
dislikereview: The wifi was a bit weak for a work call I took. I tried to hardwire in using an ethernet cable I'd brought (there seemed to be a port for this at the desk) but that didn't work at all. I went back to the wifi, keeping my video off and that worked for the most part. I might just have caught a bad day, and if i'd stayed longer i could have asked for support but i was only there for 1 night so didn't inquire about fixing it.

title: Lovely staff members, very good hotel, very service-oriented!
likereview: Wonderful staff members at reception! Very kind and helpful!Room was a good size. I booked the club room.  Also, the hotel is in a quiet location.I did not have breakfast at the hotel
dislikereview: Nothing really. They are doing a great job at this hotel!

title: Great stay
likereview: Staff were amazing, location was great and hotel was spotless!
dislikereview: N/A

title: Great location
likereview: Quiet room. Lovely staff. Helpful and friendly
dislikereview: Would prefer to get the bed sheets changed after the first night

title: Great location Great staff & Great food
likereview: Everything really lovely location
dislikereview: Nothing exceptional

title: 5 day break in London
likereview: staff were friendly and very helpful.
dislikereview: no window in our room except for a ceiling  window which was covered and was very noisy when it rained,air con fan on ceiling above the bed,had to put my earplugs in.Green security light at door and on the corner off the tv their was a clock which was illuminated at night. House keeping could have been better, no hand towels or replacement toilet roll on 1day, no biscuits left on 2 day, and we walked into our room at 4.15 expecting our room to be made up on our 3 day and had to go down to reception to let them know.

title: Short Break
likereview: Not much, really enjoyed the stay.
dislikereview: Great location, close to lots of excellent restaurants. Easy to find, staff were very knowledgeable and efficient. Overall we would stay here again.

title: Great stay with improvements.
likereview: Everything else.
dislikereview: Ground floor room felt a little out the way with an underwhelming site of litter outside the window. Also noise from kitchen wasn't too welcoming.

title: Very good
likereview: The room was very small... I could open the curtains unless I climbed over the bed. The bathroom layout had going to the toilet quite awkward.
dislikereview: The cleanliness and attitude of the staff was class..

title: Excellent weekend
likereview: Nothing to mention
dislikereview: Great service, very friendly staff. Excellent location with some great restaurants close by. The room was very clean, great facilities.

title: We were pleasantly surprised at the friendly and helpful staff.
likereview: The room was very clean and the staff were very friendly, polite and helpful.

title: great find
likereview: the hotel was in the perfect location for a concert at the Royal Albert Hall and there are lots of local pubs and restaurants!
dislikereview: their restaurant wasn’t quite up and running (think they said 1st November?), so we ate and drank locally instead

title: Good
likereview: Clean with friendly staff. Good location to the tube station and quiet. Comfortable bed and good working shower.Excellent room service meal which was wonderful after a very late check in. TV worked well. Would stay again for its location and staff.
dislikereview: Temperature of the room was cold on arrival. Took a few hours to reach a comfortable temperature.Wifi only worked at the dressing table area best. Breakfast wasn’t as good as the room service dinner. The Chicken tikka masala was excellent and Apple pie but the buffet breakfast was disappointing in comparison. Generally the staff were lovely and gave the place a nice atmosphere.

title: Just book it!!
likereview: Possibly one of the best locations and neighborhoods for a great stay in London. The staff and everyone at reception were very pleasant and always helpful. I have to particularly mention Dorio, Mitul, Anna and Eies. I had a long stay and I most certainly will be making Park Grand Kensington my base in London. Book a triple room if you can just for more space, otherwise the club room (though small) is comfortable! I stayed in both.

title: Good stay, will book again
likereview: The hotel was in a great location and the staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good value for money and love how they provide bottled water and the little chocolates on the bed was a nice touch. The tea facilities in the room were handy and the kettle was clean inside as well.
dislikereview: The cleaning of rooms needs improvement and not to my standard. The staff let me changed rooms and were all fine with it. Second room the bed still had a few hairs in it, better than my first room but noticed this is quite common with a lot of hotels. The shower wasn't as clean, needed a good scrub where the doors are and my toilet paper was wet. Also would have been nice if the bed had a mattress protector on it instead of a plain sheet.Also theirs a green light in the room that stays on so if you like to sleep in a black darkness room bring a eye mask

title: Very Nice
likereview: Very clean, staff very helpful and attentive, the hair dryer in the room was faulty advised the reception staff before breakfastAnd they had replace it by the time I got back to the room.
dislikereview: The break was a good choice but could offer fresh fruit.

title: Marvellous hotel
likereview: The staff were exceptional they even put a small bottle of wine and a card for my wife's birthday in the room. Had a fantastic meal in the hotel restaurant will definitely return.
dislikereview: N/A

title: Great stay, great staff. Will defo book again
likereview: Excellent location
dislikereview: Lift, needs two.

title: Superb
likereview: Great location for all the Kensington sights and museums all within a 15/20 min work or a couple of tube stops if you’d rather travel that way. Staff all lovely! Breakfast good, good amenities in the room, comfy bed, underfloor heating in the bathroom.
dislikereview: Dropped something during my stay and was looking for it on the carpet. Noticed that it had probably been a while since it had been hoovered under the bed itself. That was the only negative the room was otherwise very clean as we overall had a great stay.

title: Nice hotel
likereview: Clean hotel. Close to Earls Court tube station. Friendly staff

title: Excellent location, close to amenties and very helpful staff
likereview: Staff were very friendly and accomodating. Room was big and it was clean and very quiet. Big TV that had good quality picture and sound. I was given chocolates on my pillow whn I arrived and there were two bottles of water in the room which were added to the next day. I was even offered water to take with me when I checked out. There as a fridge in the room which was very useful as I hadn't paid for breakfast so I was able to go to a supermarket closeby to grab some fruit the night before.

title: Good
likereview: Hotel was good value, clean and close to a tube station
dislikereview: The room was smaller than the photos, there was a green light (fire) in the room which was really bright and kept me awake for most of the night. We were told checkout was noon but at 9.20am we had housekeeping knocking on the door ready to clean when I queried checkout time he said he’d return in an hour

title: Perfect stay for a London Getaway
likereview: The staff were excellent. The room was spacious and extremely comfortable.
dislikereview: The only minor complaint that I have is that we were in one of the lower floor rooms and the hotel WiFi did not work in there, and with no phone signal that was a little inconvenient.

title: Very good
likereview: Comfortable bed and room. And very accessible to trains and tubes
dislikereview: Need more breakfast choices

title: Superb
likereview: Great location for easy access to museums and London being in very close proximity to Earls Court tube station.  The property was nice the rooms comfy and provided everything needed for a comfortable stay.  Rooms were cleaned every day with fresh towels provided.  Staff were very helpful and polite.  Nothing too much trouble.
dislikereview: Nothing

title: Great stay.
likereview: Great location, clean, comfortable, very friendly staff.
dislikereview: Restaurant menu was very sparse and no child friendly options really. Was very clean and nice though. Plenty of other options very close by so wasn’t too big of an issue. Just would have been nice to not have to go out again.

title: Superb
likereview: The staff and decoration comfotble matteress
dislikereview: The pillows I had a terrible nights sleep I asked for other pillows and I recieved lumpy flat pillows .

title: Excellent value for money and just what we wanted
likereview: Excellent location, quiet room and comfortable bed and room temperature.
dislikereview: Would have been a bit small for longer than a few nights.

title: A happy discovery !
likereview: Was looking for a one night stay in London to cover a theatre evening without rushing for train home. Found Park Grand near Earls Court and was surprised to find what looked like a very new building in a typical Earls Court Terrace of (former) grand apartments. 2 minutes walk to Earls Court Station. Reception staff very helpful, professional and friendly and we checked in around 1.45 pm to a lovely room, more spacious than I expected, excellent bath/shower/toilet and a comfortable chair (which is not always the case). Plus writing pad and pen which is even rarer. As well as coffee/tea facilities, hotel provided 2 small bottles of water-again, very much appreciated. We opted to enjoy leisurely breakfast next morning which was delivered in spacious restaurant area by very attentive staff and good buffet choices. Amazingly this was only £ 10 per person. As the hotel room was just £ 114 this represented excellent value for money and I've already booked my next one night's stay for a business meeting in November. Surprised also to find this small chain has about 10 properties in London.
dislikereview: Not even the weather needed improvement

title: Great staff and service.  Nice hotel at a great location and at a reasonable price.
likereview: Very nice shower. Mini fridge and safe were useful. Bed was comfortable, but see dislikes below.
dislikereview: The duvet is far too warm. With it I was too hot and sweating, but without it I was cold.The walls are not soundproof. One night someone in an adjacent room turned on the TV late at night.  It kept me awake until I finally put in earplugs. Very annoying.

title: Good
likereview: Rooms were clean, well equipped and a decent size. Reception staff were a delight!
dislikereview: The login for the WiFi was hugely chauvinistic! Only Dr and Mrs, no Ms - this is 21st century UK. The breakfast was disappointing including the food choice, service and definitely the music…which was very bizarre!

title: Superb
likereview: The staff were excellent. Room was very clean and comfortable. Food in the bar was great.

title: Very good
likereview: Location and staff
dislikereview: Bedroom a bit stuffy

title: Really enjoyed our stay
likereview: Really enjoyed our stay at the hotel, staff were really friendly, the whole place was nice and clean, from reception to the rooms. Room was spacious and had good facilities, shower was really nice.
dislikereview: No negatives

title: A good option in Earl's Court
likereview: A good option in Earl's Court, a practical location for me. Staff were very pleasant, lent me an umbrella when it rained, and were generally responsive to any needs.
dislikereview: Breakfast was not great: one expects a decent English breakfast when in the UK!

title: London trip
likereview: The location was excellent. Staff helpful and friendly. Good breakfast.
dislikereview: Room was small . Not a varied menu in restaurant.

title: Brilliant stay would look to stay here in the future
likereview: Brilliant location and very very comfortable room. The hotel felt very safe for a single female traveller
dislikereview: The wifi was a bit hit and miss in the room

title: Very good
likereview: The location and staff were amazing. Good aircon in the room and the window could also be opened. Plenty changing points and water, tea/coffe, biscuits etc replenished daily when housekeeping attended. Staff at reception were super friendly and gave complimentary bottles of water when required.
dislikereview: The room wasn’t ready when we arrived and when we did get access there were still crumbs on the carpet, there was still a toothpaste stain in the bathroom cup and the grouting/sealing  in the shower has seen better days.The rooms weren’t very sound proofed and we could hear when next door were at the toilet, having a shower and being sick during the night.

title: Superb
likereview: Good mid level solution to a room in London

title: Superb
likereview: Staff where really lovely and welcoming

title: Amazing stay, amazing staff!
likereview: Fantastic location, very clean hotel and lovely rooms. Staff couldn’t have done enough for us! Wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again!

title: Friendly staff, great location, free room upgrade! Would definitely stay again.
likereview: The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. They kindly upgraded our room for free. The location was spot on and close to the underground. The free luggage storage is a real added bonus. The hotel felt safe with 24 hour reception. We loved our upgrade, and the bed was super comfy.
dislikereview: Superior room is not what you think. Club room is the better sized room. Downstairs rooms are below ground level and therefore dark with no fresh air. Breakfast was fresh but basic. Bedsheets in the first room were marked in places. The shower was great, with hot water & good pressure, but needed some TLC in places. Also, the wallpaper was ripped in some areas and needs tidying up.

title: Good
likereview: Great location, friendly staff and generously sized room
dislikereview: Extremely bright red standby light on television which lights up the room at night. Impossible to turn off or hide. Made it impossible to sleep comfortably.

title: Very good
likereview: Central location
dislikereview: Room was clean comfortable but small

title: Above and beyond!
likereview: A lovely stay with Park Grand, I particularly loved the warm reception we received on arrival and how lovely they had set our room up for my birthday - the special touches and card really made my weekend! Thank you so much!

title: Superb

Didn’t eat in the restaurant however it looked lovely.
dislikereview: Check in was about an hour delayed however the staff were very apologetic for this! I feel our room wasn’t as clean as it could have been (a few hairs and water marks in the bathroom). However we loved the stay and would definitely stay again.

title: Can definitely recommend.
likereview: Good location with nearly few restaurants, Tesco and not far from Olympia Centre. Friendly staff ready to assist. Room service was great as we were very tired and didn't want to go out.
dislikereview: I would say if you need a cab organise it yourself - the service that reception are using is a rip off unfortunately. I would advise to change the supplier as private cab should not cost you 2.5 times more than normal one.

dislikereview: Not enough teas, coffees etc. We had to request more as only had one English teabag each.

title: Superb

dislikereview: room a bit small

title: Great stay
likereview: The property was in a great location and the room was very comfortable. Lots of friendly helpful staff.

title: Superb
likereview: The room was very spacious, with AC, they upgraded for a triple room, staff was great and very nice. Everything was clean.
dislikereview: Nothing in specific, just a toilet brush missing and the mini bar was empty, but these are small things.

title: Great location
likereview: Big comfortable bed.2 mins walk from EarlsCourt tube and some great little restaurants.Very helpful staff.
dislikereview: No bar.

title: Great Hotel
likereview: The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect as it’s right by Earl’s Court station so we found getting from the hotel to any of our destinations really quick! The staff are lovely are really accommodating, they looked after our bags before and after check in, they gave us free bottled water whenever we needed it and they always gave us service with a smile! The hotel itself has a very modern feel and it doesn’t feel like you’re staying at a “cheap” property.
dislikereview: The only thing we didn’t like was that our bed took up the majority of our room so we had to walk sideways to get to the other side of the bed and there was a gap between the bed and headboard so pillows kept falling down so we didn’t have the best sleep but neither of these things would put us off staying here again!

title: Very good
likereview: Location was brilliant, staff were really friendly
dislikereview: Pressure for hot water was really poor so couldn’t shower

likereview: Location and facilities were excellent. Staff very friendly and helpful

title: Superb

title: Happy to go back again in the near future!
likereview: Staff very attentive, room clean and comfortable. Location excellent for the museums. Nice continental breakfast in the morning.
dislikereview: Only complaint about the room was that the pillows were rather hard and flat and the shaver socket was not connected.Evening meal in the restaurant was disappointing both in terms of cost, selection and flavour. The menu offered online is not the one presented at the table. Paying £21.50 in advance based on the advertised menu but when sat down the menu was £15.99 - we were offered a few chicken dishes in addition. I was told that the restaurant is not owned by the hotel.

dislikereview: It wasn’t made clear that if you wanted your room cleaned, you had the press the maids button so it turned green. We were unaware of this and therefore put all dirty towels on the floor. After being out all day, we came back to our room to realise it hadn’t been cleaned. I think this should be made more obvious.

title: Excellent location, good value, clean comfortable hotel with exceptional staff hospitality

dislikereview: There was not much to dislike about the hotel.

title: Great boutique hotel !!
likereview: Staff were very friendly.  The check in and check out was swift. The hotel also holds your luggage if you wanted to go out so that was very good option.
dislikereview: Housekeeping kept forgetting to provide coffee sachets and also more bottles of shampoo then shower gel !

title: Good Stay
likereview: Great location, about 4 minutes walk form Earl’s Court station and about half an hours walk from Hyde Park/ Kensington Gardens. Upon arrival we was greeted with 2 bottles of water and once we entered our bedroom there was a complimentary bottle of Merlot, a box of chocolate truffles and a personal note written to us. It was such a beautiful gesture. The decor in the hotel was also lovely our hotel room faced the traditional town houses so the view was lovely !
dislikereview: Dirty bedside drawers with quiet a bit of hair in there. The beds were 2 singles put into one bed which means 1 accidentally moved and I found a bit of tissue under it. The doors in the hallway have only 1 little window which means you can’t really see anyone coming through so I got hit by a room attendant . She did apologise. £5 tray change if you wish to get your breakfast in your room. But £2 for dinner which I thought ????

title: Very good
likereview: Everything

title: Very good value, small hotel in quiet location
likereview: Well located small hotel, just minutes from Earls Court tube station and a range of food outlets like M&S Simply Food, Pret etc. Staff were friendly and helpful - I appreciated the bottle of water handed to me on check out. My room was not big but it wasn't a problem, having everything I needed including a microwave and mini fridge. Bed was comfortable with good pillows. Bathroom was small but was clean & modern, good shower. Room was quiet - some road noise first thing in the morning but no big deal. Didn't pay for breakfast from hotel so can't comment on that.
dislikereview: Only negative thing I found was the bright green light in my room which meant my room was never really dark - luckily I always travel with an eye mask so it won't stop me booking at this hotel next time I want to be in this location.

title: Pleasant, nice room, clean, great customer service, location & value - highly recommend!

It would have been handy to have a menu in the room incase we wanted to dine with you or order room service.
dislikereview: There was dirty pillow cases left in the room from the privous people on the floor,  there was hair all in the shower on the tiles and rubbish behind the bin under the dressing table had been left. Also we had the crisps from the mini bar opened them and  they tasted stale we then looked at the date on the back and they where out of date.

title: Will return again!
likereview: Location and staff Frequent guest
dislikereview: Value for money

title: Delightful hotel with all the touches!
likereview: Great location, warm welcome, good ammenities!

title: Comfortable stay, lovely helpful staff
likereview: Particularly helpful and friendly staff. Comfortable room and very clean in the sleeping area. Nice clean towels, complimentary snacks and drinks.
dislikereview: Bathroom is very small. No place for toiletries - no shelf. Could be left at the side of the hand basin but every chance that they would have fallen into the toilet! Shower not great, water pressure could be better. Shower and screen looked a little dirty and could be improved upon.

title: Clean, comfy and roomy accommodation serviced by friendly and very helpful staff.
likereview: The general friendliness of the helpful staff. Every problem was resolved quickly.My wife has 2 dietary problems. She's a coeliac and also has a high intolerance to fish and all seafood. That was picked up from the start as I had informed the hotel in advance. Every breakfast my wife was offered gluten-free bread toast which was then brought to our table while still hot.The hotel's location is close to Earls Court Station which is on the District and Piccadilly lines on the London underground. This was something that was ideal for us given the places we wanted to get to. I must also say that we found the staff at Earls Court Station to be very helpful with advice on what to do about getting around. We felt that our Superior Double Room was ideal and spacious enough for our needs.
dislikereview: The breakfast, I felt, could have been a bit more varied. It remained virtually the same for every one of the 4 days we were there. That said, the staff here were more than happy to help where they could. For example, there are several a la carte breakfast dishes available though this was an additional cost to the £15 already paid for breakfast. These included omelettes, pancakes and other items.

title: Exceptional
likereview: Pleasant staff, brilliant service, great location
dislikereview: The room was small.

title: Very welcoming and comfortable stay.

Unfortunately didn’t get to experience their restaurant as we were always out in London, but maybe next time.

title: A memorable stay in more ways than one.
likereview: Clean, comfortable and quiet. Well priced, good location and accommodating staff. We were staying over for the Test match at lords between England and South Africa which was the only test England lost all summer and finish within 4 hours on day 3. I had tickets for days 3 and 4 for me and my wife. The hotel understood our difficult day as cricket fans and allowed us to cancel the second night of our day, which saved us money and less aggrieved at the cricket result. We had a nice expansive steak meal at the steak and co near by. It was such a good stay here that it also appears we conceived our first child here, so not a stay we will likely forget.
dislikereview: We didn’t go for the breakfast as it was too expensive, but most hotel breakfasts are overpriced!

title: Fortunately, after the initial hiccough, our stay was very pleasant and comfortable.
likereview: The breakfast was very good value for money especially as the hotel is in London.The staff were very polite and helpful.Earls  Court Tube station is very nearby.There are numerous eating places within easy walking distance.The air conditioning was relatively quiet.We could open the windows of our room (on the first floor) if we wanted to.
dislikereview: I would have given my experience at this hotel a higher rating if we hadn’t been allocated a lower ground (basement) room on arrival. The room was extremely dark with bars at the window and, as the air conditioning did not work properly, was very hot and airless. After complaining bitterly, particularly as we were told on arrival that we had been given an upgrade due to the hotel being full, we were found a room on the first floor. The new room met all the expectations I had when making the booking about 3 weeks before.It is worth noting that taxis further into the centre of London are not easily acquired due to congestion charges etc. We were there for a parent’s funeral in Covent Garden and did not want to use public transport. So allow plenty of time to acquire a taxi and for getting to your destination if it is time specific.

title: Good
likereview: good location, a few minutes walk from Earls Court tube station.  Arrived to be given a free upgrade and complimentary bottle of Prosecco by Nelly the receptionist when we said we had just got engaged great nights sleep on a very comfortable bed good breakfast, great staff, very happy to help

title: Good
likereview: Location, walking distance to evening event.
dislikereview: No windows in the room. Charged extra for breakfast, which was below average. No easy waiting service for coffee, no table clearing, lots of dirty tables. Disappointing.

title: Nice hotel for the money! Close to underground station Earl's Court!
likereview: Staff were very friendly, helpful and polite! Underground station nearby, useful! Hotel close to shops and amenities. Cooked breakfast good!
dislikereview: Room a bit on the small size; air con wouldn't drop below 19 degrees (we were in a heat wave), plug in sink didn't work (push down type)! Not enough selection on Continental breakfast!

title: Great locations with a very pleasant staff.
likereview: I traveled with my mom for a 3 day weekend, as we arrived at the hotel we were nicely greeted by the staff.A gentleman carried all of our belongings to our room, however, once we got there my mom wasn't pleased with our room. Our view was to a brick wall. We immediately called the front desk to see if we could get a different room, the woman at the reception was so kind and didn't ask further explanations or questions, she was very agreeable and got us a different room right away. With a much nicer view!The rest of our stay was very pleasant. The breakfast buffet was good and the staff was again, very pleasant.Overall it was a very nice stay!
dislikereview: Our first room had a terrible view and we had to go through many different hallways, stairs, and doors to get there.Hence, a further reason why we changed rooms.

title: 4 star, I don't think so
likereview: I booked a four night break to celebrate my partners birthday, Elis the receptionist was very helpful and friendly, she upgraded our room and sent up some wine, breakfast was good, location was 2mins from Earls court station.
dislikereview: I booked this hotel because of the reviews, and it stated the the rooms had sound proofing, this was clearly not the case we were awoken several times on the first night by the person in the next room slamming doors, and talking which we could clearly hear, we had the same thing on the last night. Also, we found stains on the carpet which had a gap next to the wall, the windows were dirty.  There was a spare bed, and mattress  stored in front of a window in the hallway. We found the menu very limited if you don't like Indian cuisine. It was nice to have complementary soft drinks in the room but no bottle opener provided.We felt the hotel was in need of an upgrade and a bit more attention to detail was needed.

title: Superb
likereview: Stayed for one night. Spotlessly clean, very comfortable bed. Had a great night sleep extremely quiet at night. Staff polite and helpful (apart from, I presume a bell boy, who just seemed to just stare menacingly!) I can't comment on food as we didn't eat there but restaurant looked spotless and the breakfasts we saw looked great! .. Would stay again.
dislikereview: Nothing really!

title: Pricey and worth it. Very polite and helpful staff
likereview: Location: within 5 minutes you're at Earl's Court station. Good places to get something small to eat (breakfast or lunch)Gloucester Road station isn't too far away, but is a short walk (it is the next station). Kensington Gardens is within a short distance and easy to reach on foot, as well as Kensington Palace. Reception: very motivated and friendly receptionists and I found them very helpful and efficient.
dislikereview: The maid had not been too thorough cleaning the bathroom corners (near the sink). If a toothbrush or a small article falls between the shower and the sink, you might find some unpleasant proof of a former occupant. All the sheets should have been changed by the maid, and not only the top one. Often the cleaning staff don't speak English well, so it should be communicated to them that fine establishments have guests that are happy to pay for immaculate rooms (and beds). We had a Deluxe Double room. This was a bit smaller than a similar establishment I stayed in near King's Cross (with a similar price class), as the bathroom was much smaller at the Park Grand. There is not much room for cosmetics and travel accessories in the bathroom. For a few days, this is ok.

title: Very good
likereview: The location in the Kensington quarter was great, 4-minute walk from Earl's Court on Piccadilly Line, and lots of good  options nearby. Bathroom was clean and nice.
dislikereview: Wifi was slow and not usable. Reception area was rather small with not much seating space for more than 3 people to be waiting for a cab etc.

There was no sign of the IPad. About 1 hour later I received a knock on my door with a complementary bottle of Wine and a note for complementary breakfast the following morning to compensate me for the earlier disturbance. Fantastic gesture by the Hotel staff.
