title: Overall is fair to say we were very disappointed with being transferred to The Chilworth, Paddington
likereview: Some aspects of the aesthetics of the hotel were appealing. Most of the hotel staff were friendly and approachable.
dislikereview: We ended up being transferred to The Chilworth Hotel in Paddington. Firstly, this was an issue because all of the restaurants and bars which we had booked were all around Kensington & Covent Garden so this meant issues with travelling considering most of the tube is shut at night. For the inconvenience of this we were given a complimentary continental breakfast which was extremely disappointing, for two people we received two miniature croissants, 2 bits of cold toast, 2 small boxes of cereal which were not eaten due to there being no choice of cereal and 2 small yogurts with a banana and apple, when we had left breakfast it was fair to say we were still substantially hungry. Secondly, we paid for a larger room with larger facilities, we ended up with a small room with 2 single beds pushed together with minimal room around the bed which was a huge disappointment and the bathroom was extremely small and I struggled to have a comfortable shower due to the shower head being so low and the space in the shower cubical being minimal. There was also issues with the power on the first night when we checked in, the power kept turning off after a minute which we were baffled by, we went down to the hotel reception in the morning and they had a little chuckle and gave us more key cards to put in the power slot, I found this to be inconvenient when trying to get ready in the evening and rushing around trying to get to places on time because of the changed location. The bed was also an issue with it being two single beds pushed together as it meant there was an uncomfortable gap in the middle of the both of us. Also there was a mini fridge which would have been a good addition but due to it being uneven any bottles you put in there just rolled straight to the door and then when the door was opened just fell on the floor which was slightly annoying when waking up in the middle of the night for a cold drink. Value for money was certainly not the case at The Chilworth.

dislikereview: Definitely not the standard of a 4 stars. Very expensive too.Lack of cleanness and hygiene - dusty, hairs and mould Noisy hotel due to them wall Cheap furniture and decor - stained bedding and chips furniture Major health and safety issues Lack of respect and ethics from from front desk staff- move my belongings to another room without my consent and even informing me then lied about it Theft - I left my Rolex watch and make up set in the drawer and went to wok. Came back that evening to notice that they have moved me room and those are missing. Raise those to manager but he denied that theft

Impossible to wash away properly the soap/shampoo No parking. We got 2 parking tickets in one day with the disable badge...it's different rools in this area.....my husband had to park far away, to walk back and change the parking after 3 hours. So basically every 2 hours he had to walk to move the car and find a different parking. Very disappointed. We leave in London we didn't want to drive far away, came to rest but went home teird. We paid a lot of money for 4 nights. We could sleep at home, save this money,  travel every day to a different destination And enjoy.  We are very disappointed. Sorry about that but we didn't enjoy it.  Sofi Einigher

title: Definitely not a 4 star hotel & Would like a refund!
likereview: The staff were lovely
dislikereview: They need to upgrade the windows as in the morning we were woken up to the sound of the binmen collecting the locals bins. You can also hear people from outside. You don’t get peace and quiet at this hotel that’s for certain! We paid for a deluxe twin room… it was far from deluxe. The room was tiny! I have stayed at 5 star hotels in London for £30 more than what we paid and had a room twice the size of this one. It’s definitely not a 4 star hotel. Rooms of that size aren’t big enough for two people to get ready with a comfortable amount of space. There was no minibar in the room. Instead you get a piece of paper with 5 drink options… every decent hotel room, especially one that is meant to be 4 stars should have a minibar in the room. There were no glasses in the room also which is very annoying. The bedding was creased also which for a hotel in Kensington is not acceptable. The room wasn’t that clean either. There was some stains on the wall. One we beloved was a big ketchup stain… or so we hoped was a ketchup stain! The shower temperature changes whilst using the shower. The air con did not work! The room was very hot and uncomfortable.I wouldn’t recommend people stay here. You can spend an extra £30-50 and have a much more enjoyable experience elsewhere.

title: Bad
dislikereview: Was due to go to this hotel on the 27th July 2020 after booking via Booking.com earlier in the month ,But at 9am of the 27th July received a phone call from the Front desk of the Hotel stating that they had not reopened and they had transferred my booking to The Chilworth Hotel in Paddington. This was then followed by an email to confirm and state actual address telephone number etc.I booked The Park Grand Kensington as I enjoy the area where it's located and have stayed at the Premier inn just around the corner a couple of times but thought I would have a change this time so you could understand my surprise at being told as I was preparing to leave home on the arrival date,which seemed very late and didn't really have a choice where to stay .Anyway I found the Chilworth Hotel ok and was given free breakfast for both of us for the whole stay as a sorry for the cock up even though we're not really a breakfast couple as prefer to get up and go out .The staff were friendly and professional and even though the room was on the small or bijou as I think they call it ,I found it clean and comfortable. The Covid strategy worked perfectly and they even took your temperature on arrival .Access to the underground was a couple of mins walk .I would stay at the Chilworth again if wanted to stay in the Paddington area but think it may be a Premier Inn in South Kensington as at least they tell you things when you book

title: Amazing
likereview: Upon arrival we were greeted by a very kind doorman who took our bags for us and we were offered a complimentary upgrade which was lovely. The room was beautiful, it had everything we needed and more from a fridge to a microwave. The room was spotlessly clean. All staff were so friendly and couldn’t do enough for you. The bed was super comfy and the shower was really powerful which you don’t always get in hotels. The location is perfect, plenty of pubs and restaurants nearby and only up the road from the tube station. Didn’t hear any street noise, it was really peaceful. Park Grand is one of the best hotels I’ve stayed in. Thank you for an amazing stay and for looking after us so well, we already can’t wait to book our next stay with you

title: Perfectly okay.
likereview: The location is excellent—a couple of minutes from Earl's Court tube station. The service was friendly and responsive—when I asked to be moved rooms, they helped me out immediately. The room and bathroom were very clean.
dislikereview: It was advertised as particularly quiet, but it wasn't quiet. In the room I was first given, I could hear conversations in adjoining rooms easily. I asked to be moved to a quieter room. I could hear noises from adjoining rooms from that room too, but the neighbours weren't particularly chatty so it didn't matter. All the same, this should not be advertised as a hotel that's particularly suitable for light sleepers, I think. The bed linen felt rather cheap, too.I couldn't turn some of the lights off in my room without removing my entry card from its slot. But that meant that all the systems (air conditioning and so on) shut down too. In the end I unscrewed the light bulbs—a workable solution, but not ideal.The breakfast was fine, but there wasn't any muesli option.

In the room itself the air conditioning and the fridge did not work and the drains in the bathroom were clogged so they took forever to drain.  The staff weren’t rude but they certainly were not welcoming to be honest I would’ve been better booking a travel lodge

title: Mold in bathrooms and pricy for the hotel quality
likereview: location: proximity to tube station - Piccadilly line direct to Heathrow Airport then walking distance to hotel on Hogarth Rd.
dislikereview: This property is in desperate need of several updates and is not a 4 star property!  There was full grown MOLD in the bathroom, plus no ventilation, and clogged drains, cracked ceiling  walls that was patched and very visible to the eyes across entire room, old OLd dingy carpets and furniture, old and worn beds with dips and bumps, NOISY thin walls and very Noisy air conditioner vents, loud and noisy maids from the hall ways, my room phone was not working in the room, took 24 hrs to fix, the gym is like dungeon with equipment, I went back to my room to attempt my workout instead. I had to keep going up and downstairs cos keycards use old tech and stopped working several times, so much much more! They try to compensate for this lowly maintained hotel by giving guests goodies on Arrival, nice but don’t, use the money instead to update this hotel, not 4 stars at all.  You will be paying for access to Earls Court mostly.
